Description: Nonsense, frameshift, canonical splice spite, initiation codon, single/multiexon deletion
Name: Null variants

Description: Same AA change as previously established pathogenic variant (Regardless of nt change)
Name: Established Pathogenic Variant

Description: De novo (BOTH maternity and paternity confirmed) in a patient with the disease and no family history
Name: De novo variant

Description: Well-established in vitro or in vivo functional studies supportive of a damaging effect on the gene or gene product
Name: Functional studies support damaging effect

Description: The prevalence of the variant in affected individuals is significantly increased compared with the prevalence in controls (Case-control studies show enrichment in cases)
Name: Enrichment in cases

Description: Located in a mutational hotspot and/or critical and well-established functional domain without benign variation
Name: Mutational hotspot

Description: Absent from population studies (Absent from ESP and 1000 genomes..)
Name: Absent from population studies

Description: For recessive disorders, detected in trans with a pathogenic variant
Name: Detected in trans

Description: Protein length changes as a result of in-frame deletion/insertions in a nonrepeat region or stop-loss variant (In-frame del/in in a well-characterised functional domain)
Name: Protein length changes

Description: Novel missense change at an amino acid residue where a different missense change determined to be pathogenic has been seen before
Name: Novel missense mutation

Description: Assumed de novo, but without confirmation of paternity and maternity
Name: Assumed de novo

Description: Cosegregation with disease in multiple affected family members in a gene definitively known to cause the disease disease (Occurs in a gene with high clinical specificity and sensitivity for the cancer)
Name: Cosegregation with disease

Description: Missense variant in a gene that has a low rate of benign missense variation and in which missense variants are a common mechanism of disease (Type of variant fits mutational spectrum)
Name: Variant fits mutational spectrum

Description: Multiple lines of computational evidence support a deleterious effect on the gene or gene product (conservation, evolutionary, splicing impact, etc.)
Name: Computational evidence shows deleterious effect

Description: Patient’s phenotype or family history is highly specific for a disease with a single genetic etiology (Proband’s family study shows co-segregation with disease)
Name: Patient's phentoype/family history supports pathogenicity

Description: Reputable source recently reports variant as pathogenic, but the evidence is not available to the laboratory to perform an independent evaluation (Noted as pathogenic in curated locus specific database)
Name: Noted as pathogenic in curated locus specific database

Description: Population studies, allele frequency >5% in ESP and 1000 Genomes Project
Name: In population studies >5%

Description: Allele frequency is greater than expected for disorder
Name: High allele frequency

Description: Observed in a healthy adult individual for a recessive (homozygous), dominant (heterozygous), or X-linked (hemizygous) disorder, with full penetrance expected at an early age
Name: Observed in a healthy adult

Description: Well-established in vitro or in vivo functional studies show no damaging effect on protein function or splicing
Name: Established to be not damaging

Description: Lack of segregation in affected members of a family
Name: Lacking segregation

Description: Missense variant in a gene for which primarily truncating variants are known to cause disease (Type of variant does not fit mutational spectrum)
Name: Does not fit mutational spectrum

Description: Observed in trans with a pathogenic variant for a fully penetrant dominant gene/disorder or observed in cis with a pathogenic variant in any inheritance pattern (For fully penetrant cancer syndrome, observed with another pathogenic variant in the same individual)
Name: Observed with another pathogenic variant

Description: In-frame deletions/insertions in a repetitive region without a known function (Located in a region without a characterised function or away from known mutation hot-spot)
Name: Away from mutational hot-spot

Description: Multiple lines of computational evidence suggest no impact on gene or gene product (conservation, evolutionary, splicing impact, etc.)
Name: Computational evidence shows no impact

Description: Variant found in a case with an alternate molecular basis for disease
Name: Alternate molecular basis for disease

Description: Reputable source recently reports variant as benign, but the evidence is not available to the laboratory to perform an independent evaluation (Noted as benign in a curated locus specific database)
Name: Sources report as benign

Description: A synonymous (silent) variant for which splicing prediction algorithms predict no impact to the splice consensus sequence nor the creation of a new splice site AND the nucleotide is not highly conserved
Name: Predicted as benign synonymous variant
